meanings.definition: A list or record of items.
meanings.sent1: I keep a catalog of my stamp collection.
meanings.sent2: The library has a catalog of all the books available for borrowing.
meanings.sent3: The catalog of toys in the store made me want to buy everything.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a catalog, neatly organizing every memory.
meanings.sent5: The catalog of birds in the region was so detailed, it helped me identify a rare species.

meanings.definition: To make a list or record of items.
meanings.sent1: She catalogs her recipes in a special notebook.
meanings.sent2: The museum catalogs each artifact with care.
meanings.sent3: He catalogs his thoughts before making a decision.
meanings.sent4: The detective catalogs the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The scientist catalogs each specimen meticulously for research purposes.

meanings.definition: A publication containing a list of items for sale.
meanings.sent1: I received a catalog from the furniture store.
meanings.sent2: The clothing catalog showcases the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: The catalog of gadgets tempted me to buy a new phone.
meanings.sent4: Her room looked like a catalog showroom with all the products neatly displayed.
meanings.sent5: The catalog of plants in the nursery helped me choose the perfect flowers for my garden.
